author: Special Correspondent
text:
The finals of The Hindu Young World Painting competition, presented by Thyrocare, will be held at Avinashilingam Deemed University on Sunday. The event is an integral part of the Newspaper in Education programme of The Hindu .

The competition will start at 9.30 a.m. and the contestants should report at the venue by 9 a.m. Intimation letters have already been sent to the selected students. The contestants should bring the letter to the venue along with school identity card. The topics for the finals and drawing sheets will be given at the venue. The contestants should bring all other materials needed for painting. Use of sketch pens and marker pens are to be avoided

The decision of the judges will be final.. The paintings will become the sole property of The Hindu and will not be given back to the contestants. Besides prizes for the top three in each category, consolation prizes will also be given. Dr. Meenakumari Mohan, Consultant Paediatrician, Paediatric Diabetologist and Endocrinologist, is the chief guest at the valediction and will distribute prizes to the winners at 12.30 p.m. at the same venue. Other finalists will be given participation certificates. The preliminary round of competitions was held in two categories- Juniors: students of class IV to VI and seniors: classes VII to IX. Thyrocare is the presenting sponsor for the contest. Avinashilingam Deemed University for women is the venue partner. The Regional sponsors are NSR Bakers & Sweets (snacks partner), Hindustan coca-cola beverages private limited (water partner).
title: The Hindu Young World Painting Contest tomorrow
